title: Ticket #7155: Learning from the Instructors (OSG Summer School)
description:
Lauren describes the new season of HTCondor Bugs Identified During OSG School: 

Episode 1
When your job’s executable has Windows line endings, (rather than
holding with “exec format error” as in the past,) HTCondor now tells you to
submit some other way … which doesn’t fix the line endings and results in an even
more confusing error message.


Episode 2
Did you know that self-checkpointing jobs overwrite stderr and stdout after an
eviction/rematch, rather than appending?


Episode 3
HTCondor tells you you’re “rejected” if it’s still setting up your interactive
job.  (Could it, rather, say something like “setting up your job environment” ?)

And asks about the following: "By the user?" 

Episode4.log
009 (251059.002.000) 07/16 12:37:35 Job was aborted by the user.
        Job removed by SYSTEM_PERIODIC_REMOVE due to more than 10 restarts
